title: Calories in 1 Cup Flour
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup flour, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted, standard US cup measure (~125 g); no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type, brand, sifting, packing method, and measurement accuracy. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 cup of all-purpose flour contains about 455 kcal and 95 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup all-purpose flour?
faqs.a: Approximately 455 kcal for 1 cup (~125 g) unsifted all-purpose flour.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 1 cup flour?
faqs.a: About 95 g of carbohydrates, mostly starch, with 3.4 g fiber.
Moderately; 1 cup provides ~12 g protein, suitable for baking.

faqs.q: How does sifting affect calories in flour?
faqs.a: Sifted flour is lighter (~110 g per cup), reducing calories to ~400 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the difference in nutrition for whole wheat vs. white flour?
faqs.a: Whole wheat has more fiber (~12 g per cup) and slightly higher calories (~465 kcal), with similar protein.
